intro: Rhododendron periclymenoides f. glandiferum, commonly known as the glandular-leaf azalea, is a compact shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with dark green, leathery leaves that have prominent glandular dots. The plant produces showy clusters of pink to red flowers in the spring, adding ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its unique foliage and vibrant blooms make it a desirable addition to native plant collections.
